intro: Spilanthes leucantha, commonly known as white toothplant, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a cluster of tiny daisies. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and woodland habitats. Spilanthes leucantha is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
